the bad thing with rared files u have to unrar it to watch but need to keep the rared files to seed so thay take up twice the space

I know how they work, it's just a pain in the backside.

RARing up video has its use for uploading segments to sites like rapi-dshare. So you can split it up in more manageable parts and so you can redownload parts that maybe have got corrupted.

In torrents the client already downloads little sections at a time which prevents from corrupted parts ruining the whole thing. And as TBK7270 says it then takes up twice the space. It's in their interest too because people would be more likely to seed if it wasn't rared.

People complaining about rars, its mainly for the fact that if your download happens to corrupt somehow (by your PC crashing, electric going, or any other reason) you can download the RAR that is corrupted.

This is really helpful and considering you are getting this for free its worth it. Thanks TV Team!
